description.raw:
On the cloud, I've seen it happening when a bunch of `rosout` processes start being spawned and killed in an infinite loop like this:

~~~
process[rosout-1]: started with pid [22632]
[rosout-1] process has finished cleanly
log file: /home/cloudsim/.ros/log/0f5591c8-4b21-11e7-b55b-068ed08ab406/rosout-1*.log
~~~

Both times, this came accompanied of the SRCSim [Address already in use](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/srcsim/issues/181/ihmc-robotdatalogger-javanetbindexception) issue. 

@wjwwood said this might be due to multiple `roslaunch`es being launched at the same time and fighting over who gets to launch `roscore` goodies such as `rosout`. One solution would be to run `roscore` before and then run `roslaunch` with `--wait` so that it waits for `roscore` to be up and running. 

I haven't played with this on the cloud though, I suspect it might affect some CloudSim magic?
description.html:
On the cloud, I've seen it happening when a bunch of rosout processes start being spawned and killed in an infinite loop like this:

process[rosout-1]: started with pid [22632]
[rosout-1] process has finished cleanly
log file: /home/cloudsim/.ros/log/0f5591c8-4b21-11e7-b55b-068ed08ab406/rosout-1*.log

Both times, this came accompanied of the SRCSim Address already in use issue.

@wjwwood said this might be due to multiple roslaunches being launched at the same time and fighting over who gets to launch roscore goodies such as rosout. One solution would be to run roscore before and then run roslaunch with --wait so that it waits for roscore to be up and running.

I haven't played with this on the cloud though, I suspect it might affect some CloudSim magic?

title.raw: Launch a separate roscore before roslaunching
